title: Buggy and full of promotional content
text:
Becoming increasingly ineffective to use the app. On both the iPhone and iPad, the app lags dramatically after a few minutes of use. No matter the update or tips to speed up the process, it continues to drag onward. 

In between the drag, I receive constant bumps to pay for premium and must comb through a sea of promoted jobs unrelated to my search criteria.

feels more like a Facebook than a place to find a job.

title: I‚Äôve restarted and redownloaded this app so many times

title: 5 star app, 2 stars so the Devs see
text:
Since there is nowhere to submit feedback or contact LinkedIn aside from their support ticket system (which is abysmal in itself), I‚Äôm leaving my feedback here. Hopefully the developers see this and react to it. 

I love LinkedIn. It does a lot of things really well. What it does not do well at all, is the ads and finding new content outside of your immediate connections. Instagram, Twitter and Facebook all do these two points very quietly and very fluidly, so you never really notice. 

I see the same 6-7 ads on LinkedIn forever, without fail, between every two posts, until I report the ads for seeing too often. Even after I report them I will still see them for the next couple of days. I would never spend ad money on LinkedIn because the ads are so inaccurate and annoying. My marketing budget this year is $120,000 and it‚Äôs going to TikTok, Facebook, YouTube and other avenues. Zero to LinkedIn. 

The ads themselves are also just ugly. Fake content about useless (to me) softwares. I personally will not buy Salesforce, Vidyard, Spiro, Hubspot, or MapMyCustomers solely due to seeing it way too often and seeing the same exact ads on LinkedIn. 

As far as content goes, I only see content that is created by my immediate connections OR something liked by one of 10 people. I follow 1200 people, but the same 5-6 people seem to always get the top of my feed ‚ÄúJohn Smith commented on this‚Äù I don‚Äôt care what he commented on. Show me content that my third or fourth or fifth connections are making. Show me news content that is relevant to my industry. Show me stuff my competitors are talking about or interacting with. 

The networking part of LinkedIn is excellent and nowadays everyone is there. But the content is so drab and boring.

title: Latest update killed the filter.
text: Hire me! I guarantee don‚Äôt push out code that mess up core functionalities.

title: Interview scams
text: Every job that I have applied to on this site turned out to be a scam. I feel linkedin should have employers that are hiring show proof of credentials instead of letting anyone create a job post. It‚Äôs frustrating when you receive a message or email back and it end up being a scam.

title: Stalkers allowed to stalk
text: Linkedin does not protect women. My stalker has searched my profile every day of January. David S. Barbara solicited sex back in October 2023 and has a profile picture that is not professional at all. I moved from my home of 7 years after my stalker became my neighbor. I deleted my account and he still searches for me.

title: Reposted jobs are all fake
text: Ghost jobs being reposted every few days, not real jobs and no way to sort by original post date. They are more interested making money off you than providing real opportunities. Premium does not offer any advantage for job search filters.

title: OPT OUT of Recruiter View and suggestions
text: Just got a notification about my ‚ÄúRecruiter View‚Äù. How do I opt out of that. Not everyone on LinkedIn is looking for a job. Also, let us opt out of suggested contacts and posts by strangers. If you really want us to have ‚Äúthe best experience‚Äù, don‚Äôt assume we are looking for a job or want unsolicited suggestions.

title: Old school technology
text:
Been a LinkedIn user since it launched with a great idea. Conceptually it is amazing and has become a requirement for professionals. 

With that, the UX is absolutely terrible. My feed is completely saturated with influencers and random ads that have absolutely nothing to do with me. I find myself scrolling and scrolling for anything posted by my network or something that might be interesting to me. 

LinkedIn thinks it‚Äôs tech is smart enough to suggest content and even suggest what to write. 

There is some functionality that is useful with paid subscriptions; navigator, job seeking consoles, etc but the tool in its current state is absolutely awful and a real time-waster considering it‚Äôs a required addition to everyone‚Äôs professional experience.

Customer support is also terrible. They don‚Äôt know anything about their own app. Additionally, if you want to stop seeing ads from companies you don‚Äôt care about, you need to report the ad as ‚Äòterrorism‚Äô or ‚Äòsexual harassment.‚Äô Those are the only options for even attempting to clean up your feed and they work sporadically.

title: terrible customer service
text: terrible customer service and buggy platform. i‚Äôve not been able to use as according to a response my name is part of their user agreement which is in violation to use when opening a new account??  Seems an unsafe platform since it‚Äôs recent hacking. thnx but no thnx then.

title: Vanilla
text: I think the draw to LinkedIn must be more ‚Äúhip‚Äù than performance. I didn‚Äôt find anything to justify the monthly fee for premium content. You quickly apply for jobs and get email notifications. Then, nothing else. I‚Äôm surprised that AI hasn‚Äôt found a way to streamline job qualifications. There‚Äôs nothing on my resume about being a Registered Nurse yet it seems 20% of recommended jobs are for RN. I guess LinkedIn wants to honestly tell employers they set their open positions before many job seekers. Is there a way to filter out, ‚ÄúTravel Agency Customer Service?!‚Äù

title: So many scammers
text: The amount of scammers that are on LinkedIn in is concerning. The company (from what I‚Äôve seen) does not try to precedent scammers from getting on their app. Scammers are evolving. Telling your customers what to look for is no longer enough. As a company, you all need to put resources into coming up with strategies to prevent scammers from using your app. It‚Äôs not just up to your customer to weed out scammers on a service you provide. People who use these apps are looking for employment and to charger for a premium service is a bit odd. We are trying to find employment to make money. Not spend money to hopefully get employment. It‚Äôs becoming very disappointing with all of the hiring apps.

title: Horrible feature
text: Im not sure if they fixed this yet, as I deleted my app when I saw this. The once oh-so-useful ‚ÄúNetwork‚Äù tab, where I once relied on notifications for important connections adding me, has been turned into an advertising feed and now shows ‚Äúcatch up‚Äù notifications about your existing connections‚Äô random milestones. I‚Äôm happy to see (ignore) those updates in my general feed and notifications, but I don‚Äôt want filling up the space where I do actual networking and business.

title: Spam city
text: True, the app has good support with jobs, but I got WAY too many notifications. It has great job ideas, but it keeps telling me over and over like 4 times a day that there are new job opportunities, I‚Äôm good if that were to happen once maybe twice a week, but WAY TOO MUCH spam.
